concept.title: SQL Query
concept.shortdesc: The SQL query defines the data returned from the database.

conbody.p:
When you define the SQL query, use the following guidelines:
In the WHERE clause, include the offset column and the ${offset} offset value JDBC Consumer uses an offset column and value to determine the data that is returned. Include both in the WHERE clause of the query. For example, when you start a pipeline, the following query returns all data from the table where the data in the offset column is greater than the initial offset value. SELECT * FROM <tablename> WHERE <offset column> > ${offset}
In the ORDER BY clause, include the offset column as the first column To avoid returning duplicate data, use the offset column as the first column in the ORDER BY clause.
If using a LIMIT, make sure it is less than the batch size
